ygData.subject: Re: FEIGN DEATH FAILURE!!!!!!
ygData.msgSnippet: I believe GREATER dark boned skeletons are more powerful than carrion ghouls..not the normal weakling ones 8) ... From: Robb Flynn  To:
ygData.messageBody:
I believe GREATER dark boned skeletons are more powerful than carrion
ghouls..not the normal weakling ones 8)


-----Original Message-----
From: Robb Flynn <RobF@...>
To: 'EQ-Monks@onelist.com' <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
Date: Monday, August 02, 1999 4:55 AM
Subject: RE: [EQ-Monks] FEIGN DEATH FAILURE!!!!!!


>From: Robb Flynn <RobF@...>
>
>DB as in Dark Boned Skels... Not the Dry bone. And I am pretty sure,
yes...
>feel free to correct me tho =)
>
>Praelor
>
>> -----Original Message-----
>> From: beatles901@... [SMTP:beatles901@...]
>> Sent: Monday, August 02, 1999 9:39 AM
>> To: EQ-Monks@onelist.com
>> Subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] FEIGN DEATH FAILURE!!!!!!
>>
>> From: <beatles901@...>
>>
>> DBs are higher level mobs than carrion ghouls? Are you sure?!
>>
>> -----Original Message-----
>> From: Robb Flynn <RobF@...>
>> To: 'EQ-Monks@onelist.com' <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
>> Date: Monday, August 02, 1999 2:28 AM
>> Subject: RE: [EQ-Monks] FEIGN DEATH FAILURE!!!!!!
>>
>>
>> >From: Robb Flynn <RobF@...>
>> >
>> >Greetings all...
>> >
>> >Thought I would add a bit to the FD topic. Last night while hunting in
>> >Unrest, my party found ourselves overwhelmed by a train (in Unrest?
>> >Unbelievable! hehe). Well... I FD'd successfully, and was lying there
for
>> >perhaps 15 seconds, when in comes a dark boned skel and walks straight
up
>> to
>> >me and clobbers me! I jump up, nearly dead, and FD again, successful
>> again.
>> >Everything stops attacking. Party escapes with only 1 casualty, and I
>> have
>> a
>> >mere 7 hps left.
>> >
>> >Perhaps the FD, when successful, generates a "number". Any creature with
>> a
>> >number lower than the one generated is fooled. Any creature with a
higher
>> >number is not. This would explain the dark boned coming in the door and
>> >whacking me. The first number generated was high enough to fool the 3
dry
>> >bones and the 4 carrion ghouls, but not enough to fool the Dark Boned, a

>> >higher level MoB than the others. He knew I was faking it and hit me
>> >(causing the others to wail on me as well). The 2nd FD generated a
number
>> >that was able to fool them all.
>> >
>> >Now I am not a programmer or anything, but this would be similar to a
>> dice
>> >roll in DD or Palladium (for example) table top games for those of you
>> >familiar with them. There is a set minimum and a set maximum number, and
>> the
>> >level of the feign falls randomly somewhere in that range. Maybe?
>> Perhaps?
>> >
>> >What say you to this possibility?
>> >
>> >Praelor Dileasai
>> >
>> >
>> >> -----Original Message-----
>> >> From: Clint Mitchell [SMTP:mitche@...]
>> >> Sent: Friday, July 30, 1999 11:44 AM
>> >> To: EQ-Monks@onelist.com
>> >> Subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] FEIGN DEATH FAILURE!!!!!!
>> >>
>> >> From: Clint Mitchell <mitche@...>
>> >>
>> >> > Let me know if you all have noticed any difference. If ya haven't, I
>> may
>> >> be having a string of bad luck. If ya have, it might mean the demise
of
>> >> more monks out there.
>> >>
>> >> I went to Permafrost last night and used it about 4 times. Once when
I
>> >> was solo
>> >> and got attacked by several of the goblins at the entrance, once when
>> some
>> >> high
>> >> level characters brought a bunch of elites to the zone, once when an
>> ice
>> >> giant
>> >> decided to say hello, and once when I was afk. ;) It worked every
>> time
>> >> for me.
>> >>
>> >> One night in Mistmoore, before the patch, it failed on me ("Faeaani
has
>> >> fallen
>> >> to the ground") three times in a row while I was trying to get away
>> from
>> a
>> >> train
>> >> of ancilles and gypsies, but that's been the extent of my bad luck
with
>> >> FD.
>> >>
>> >> Faeaani Saillune
>> >> Level 22
>> >> Innoruuk
